poem:
Title: "Veils of Power"

In the shadow of justice, murmurs lay,
Scattered truths with no day of reckoning.
A play of power that goes unnoticed,
Perpetuating wrongs under veils of might.
Where is providence in this distorted dance,
Feeding the maw of conflict, not light?
A question kaleidoscoped, devoid of romance,
Echoing: When will the blind acquire sight?
